Articles.Content: Many people have indicated they prefer the ‘clamshell’ approach to fairings, and xEvilReeperx’s Stock Clamshell Fairing mod delivers just that. The mod adds an option in the editor for fairing bases that will allow you to group all vertical panels of a fairing together when they are jettisoned, which means fairings will always separate in two pieces like most real life rockets. If this speaks to you then check out the mod in [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124031](**this forum thread**!
Just for curiosity, why did SQUAD implement fairing jettison as an explossion, and not like in the real life?

In real life they use explosions:

[http://www.cgwic.com/LaunchServices/Download/manual/Chapter%204%20Payload%20Fairing.pdf](http://www.cgwic.com/LaunchServices/Download/manual/Chapter%204%20Payload%20Fairing.pdf)

> 
> The release mechanism for the 3350 fairing uses explosive bolts, and the separation mechanism consists of separation springs with rotating hinges.
This needs to be stock. Confetti fairings are stupid.
EXCELLENT choice of showcase mod. Squad! Implement this!

Your comment is somewhat misleading, they don't blow the fairings apart in any way similar to what is happening with stock in KSP. Explosive bolts hold the two halves of the fairings together, it is springs that push the halves apart and away. To quote the document you linked;

*"4.10.1 Lateral Release Mechanism*

*For all types of fairing, the base ring of the fairing is connected to the forward skirt of the*

*third stage with explosive bolts. The lateral explosive bolts are simultaneously detonated to*

*release the lateral connection for fairing separation.*

*4.10.2 Longitudinal Release Mechanism*

*For the 3350 fairing, the longitudinal separation system comprises twelve explosive bolts,*

*which are simultaneously released with the lateral explosive bolts at fairing separation.*

*For 3700Z, 4000F, 4200F and 4200Z fairings, the longitudinal release mechanism uses*

*notched bolts, explosive cord, expanding hose, and two explosive bolts. All these parts*

*jointly take their actions to perform the release functions.*

*4.10.3 Fairing Separation Mechanism*

*The fairing separation mechanism comprises hinges and springs, with each half of the*

*fairing being supported by two hinges. There are six separation springs on each half of the*

*fairing, and after the lateral and longitudinal release mechanisms have been activated, each*

*half of the fairing turns around the hinge under the spring force to accomplish the fairing*

*jettisoning."*

And also, SpaceX uses reusable pneumatic latches, for both the fairings and stage separation. No explosive bolts. They consider it more reliable.

Anyway, it's also visible in a lot of the launches where the onboard camera shows both halves of the fairing falling away.

Needs to be stock so badly!

Also, let the record show that I planted the seed for this to be featured this week: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123994-Modding-Monday-TAC-Life-Support?p=1991228&viewfull=1#post1991228](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123994-Modding-Monday-TAC-Life-Support?p=1991228&viewfull=1#post1991228)

Glad to see Squad highlighting this mod, at least it shows that they're aware that a lot of people aren't terribly fond of the current fairings and want something more realistic. Here's hoping that it gets integrated into stock in the near future.

There really needs to be a fairing overhaul in 1.1 or 1.2

In the meantime, this would do just great!
It completely defeats me why some people seem upset about how the stock fairings blow apart. There's no functional difference whether they fall off in two or ten pieces, is there?

If you are using Nu-FAR then the shape of the fairing is fairly important for fuel efficiency. Pointy corners are bad and a smoother transition is good.

I`ll be sticking with procedural fairings for a few things it does that we were told we would be able to do with stock fairings that turned out to be just words in the wind. Dropping the fairing as one piece for interstages being one, firing engines while still inside a fairing attached to the upper stage being another.

If anyone can confirm if this mod stops little stock faring pieces getting stuck to the payload? If you can't spin the stock fairings off your only option is to revert. I'm hoping larger pieces will spin off easier or just not get stuck in the first place.

> 
> It completely defeats me why some people seem upset about how the stock fairings blow apart. There's no functional difference whether they fall off in two or ten pieces, is there?

Sometimes smaller fairing pieces can get stuck on your craft.

Also, the confetti style separation just doesn't look cool. A lot of people want to make realistic spacecraft, and confetti fairings limit their ability to do so. It's the lack of customization that is the problem.

Squad please don't just let the community fix your game with mods. 

Please make this stock! And not just this. Give us more choice! Hide those ugly fairing bases. Remove the yellow band. Allow us to choose which side comes off first. Let us choose! 

Thank you!

Yes this stops the smaller pieces from getting stick, simply because they don't exist. Alas in order to hide the ugly base you have to clip the fairing causing a bit of a violent release.

> 
> If you can't spin the stock fairings off your only option is to revert.

They're non-persistent debris - a simple quicksave and quickload will clear them.

> 
> This is a good mod but it's still more limited than I'd like. I like the look of 3-piece clamshell fairings, rather than 2.

It doesn't restrict how many radial pieces there are, it just combines all the vertical groupings into one. So you can have 2-piece clamshell, or 3-piece, or what have you except each vertical segment won't get blown into many fragments. Just install one of the other mods that let you tweak the number of fairing arcs alongside this one.

![18cd44c9cd.png](http://puu.sh/iibfG/18cd44c9cd.png)

I did consider this but was worried it might affect how they behave compared to stock in some unintended negative way. 

If I can think of some flavor text to add to a toggle that describes what's going on, I'll add it
